commits.message:
chore(deps) Update dependency @types/node to v20.8.8 (dev) (#8098)

Co-authored-by: renovate[bot] <29139614+renovate[bot]@users.noreply.github.com>
fix(cross): Fix docker image and cross setup (#8094)

chore(ci): Replace unmaintained actions-rs GH actions, closes #8078 (#8093)

Co-authored-by: Lucas Nogueira <lucas@tauri.app>
chore: update plugins-workspace branch usage from next to v2 (#8120)

comment.body: isn't RefCell better for performance? we also had some issues with deadlock before, and since using refcell (which is also a lot easier to track that kind of issue - mutating a borrowed value in this case) we've been fine

issue.title: [feat] bindings for different languages/runtimes
issue.body:
### Describe the problem

Python is used in almost every industry, easy to use

When will python be supported as a backend language, I am very much looking forward to that day.

### Describe the solution you'd like

python as backend language

### Alternatives considered

_No response_

### Additional context

_No response_

comment.body: Probably this needs to be implemented by someone from the language community. Do you have directions on how to start implementing this? Do we have some functions callable from C / FFI that could be used?

```suggestion
  pub windows: Arc<Mutex<BTreeMap<WebviewId, WindowWrapper>>>,
```

We should use Mutex at this point even you want to use it in single thread.
This is already a control flow that has to work with tokio.
Adding lock instead of runtime check then panic is preferred behaviour imho.
